page.title: 03A DAY IN THE LIFE OF ALAN B.
page.content:
AT 6 O'CLOCK ONE MONDAY MORNING, MY FATHER AND I DECIDED TO GO TO WELSHPOOL LIVESTOCK MARKET. ONCE THE LORRY HAD BEEN FILLED WITH DIESEL WE JOURNEYED TO SEVERAL FARMS TO OBTAIN LIVESTOCK FOR THE MARKET. ONCE AT WELSHPOOL OUR ANIMALS WERE UNLOADED AND THE LORRY WAS DRIVEN TO THE PARKING GROUND TO BE CLEANED. AFTER CLEANING WE SAT DOWN TO EAT OUR SANDWICHES AND DRINK OUR COFFEE WHICH MY MOTHER HAD PREPARED FOR US. MY FATHER THEN SPOKE TO MR.JONES AND MR.EVANS WHO ASKED US TO DELIVER SOME ANIMALS FOR THEM. WHEN WE HAD DELIVERED THE ANIMALS THE LORRY HAD TO BE RETURNED TO GATE FARM. ONCE HOME WE HAD A HOT MEAL WITH THE REST OF THE FAMILY AND I TOLD THEM ALL ABOUT MY DAY AT WELSHPOOL MARKET.
**** ALAN ****
